t: John 12
The Anointing at Bethany
Six*p days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany where Lazarus was, the one Jesus had raised from the dead.
So they gave a dinner for him there; Martha was serving them, and Lazarus was one of those reclining at the table with him.
Then Mary took a pound of perfume, pure and expensive nard, anointed Jesus’s feet, and wiped his feet with her hair. So the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
Then*p one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot (who was about to betray him), said,
“Why wasn’t this perfume sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
He didn’t say this because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief. He was in charge of the money-bag and would steal part of what was put in it.
Jesus*p answered, “Leave*r her*r alone;*r she*r has*r kept*r it*r for*r the*r day*r of*r my*r burial.*r
For*r you*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r me.”*r
The Decision to Kill Lazarus
Then*p a large crowd of the Jews learned he was there. They came not only because of Jesus but also to see Lazarus, the one he had raised from the dead.
But the chief priests had decided to kill Lazarus also,
because he was the reason many of the Jews were deserting them and believing in Jesus.
The Triumphal Entry
The*p next day, when the large crowd that had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
they took palm branches and went out to meet him. They kept shouting: “Hosanna!*ibpn Blessed*iln is*i he*i who*i comes*i in*i the*i name*i of*i the*i Lord*i — the*i King*i of*i Israel!”*i
Jesus*p found a young donkey and sat on it, just as it is written:
Do*ipn not*i be*i afraid,*i Daughter*iln Zion.*i Look,*i your*i King*i is*i coming,*i sitting*iln on*i a*i donkey’s*i colt.*i

His*p disciples did not understand these things at first. However, when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things had been written about him and that they had done these things to him.
Meanwhile,*p the crowd, which had been with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead, continued to testify.
This is also why the crowd met him, because they heard he had done this sign.
Then the Pharisees said to one another, “You see? You’ve accomplished nothing. Look, the world has gone after him!”
Jesus Predicts His Crucifixion
Now*p some Greeks were among those who went up to worship at the festival.
So they came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and requested of him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
Philip went and told Andrew; then Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus.
Jesus*p replied to them, “The*r hour*r has*r come*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r to*r be*r glorified.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r unless*r a*r grain*r of*r wheat*r falls*r to*r the*r ground*r and*r dies,*r it*r remains*r by*r itself.*r But*r if*r it*r dies,*r it*r produces*r much*r fruit.*r
The*r one*r who*r loves*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r and*r the*r one*r who*r hates*r his*r life*r in*r this*r world*r will*r keep*r it*r for*r eternal*r life.*r
If*r anyone*r serves*r me,*r he*r must*r follow*r me.*r Where*r I*r am,*r there*r my*r servant*r also*r will*r be.*r If*r anyone*r serves*r me,*r the*r Father*r will*r honor*r him.*r
“Now*rp my*r soul*r is*r troubled.*r What*r should*r I*r say -*r Father,*r save*r me*r from*r this*r hour?*r But*r that*r is*r why*r I*r came*r to*r this*r hour.*r
Father,*r glorify*r your*r name.”*r Then*p a voice came from heaven: “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
The*p crowd standing there heard it and said it was thunder. Others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”
Jesus*p responded, “This*r voice*r came,*r not*r for*r me,*r but*r for*r you.*r
Now*r is*r the*r judgment*r of*r this*r world.*r Now*r the*r ruler*r of*r this*r world*r will*r be*r cast*r out.*r
As*r for*r me,*r if*r I*r am*r lifted*r up*r from*r the*r earth*r I*r will*r draw*r all*r people*r to*r myself.”*r
He said this to indicate what kind of death he was about to die.
Then*p the crowd replied to him, “We have heard from the law that the Messiah will remain forever. So how can you say, ‘The*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r be*r lifted*r up’?*r Who is this Son of Man?”

Jesus*p answered, “The*r light*r will*r be*r with*r you*r only*r a*r little*r longer.*r Walk*r while*r you*r have*r the*r light*r so*r that*r darkness*r doesn’t*r overtake*r you.*r The*r one*r who*r walks*r in*r darkness*r doesn’t*r know*r where*r he’s*r going.*r
While*r you*r have*r the*r light,*r believe*r in*r the*r light*r so*r that*r you*r may*r become*r children*r of*r light.”*r Jesus said this, then went away and hid from them.
Isaiah’s Prophecies Fulfilled
Even*p though he had performed so many signs in their presence, they did not believe in him.
This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet, who said: Lord,*ipn who*i has*i believed*i our*i message?*i And*iln to*i whom*i has*i the*i arm*i of*i the*i Lord*i been*i revealed?*i
This*p is why they were unable to believe, because Isaiah also said:

He*ipn has*i blinded*i their*i eyes*i and*iln hardened*i their*i hearts,*i so*iln that*i they*i would*i not*i see*i with*i their*i eyes*i or*iln understand*i with*i their*i hearts,*i and*iln turn,*i and*iln I*i would*i heal*i them.*i
Isaiah*p said these things because he saw his glory and spoke about him.
Nevertheless,*p many did believe in him even among the rulers, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, so that they would not be banned from the synagogue.
For they loved human praise more than praise from God.
A Summary of Jesus’s Mission
Jesus*p cried out, “The*r one*r who*r believes*r in*r me*r believes*r not*r in*r me,*r but*r in*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
And*r the*r one*r who*r sees*r me*r sees*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
I*r have*r come*r as*r light*r into*r the*r world,*r so*r that*r everyone*r who*r believes*r in*r me*r would*r not*r remain*r in*r darkness.*r
If*r anyone*r hears*r my*r words*r and*r doesn’t*r keep*r them,*r I*r do*r not*r judge*r him;*r for*r I*r did*r not*r come*r to*r judge*r the*r world*r but*r to*r save*r the*r world.*r
The*r one*r who*r rejects*r me*r and*r doesn’t*r receive*r my*r sayings*r has*r this*r as*r his*r judge:*r The*r word*r I*r have*r spoken*r will*r judge*r him*r on*r the*r last*r day.*r
For*r I*r have*r not*r spoken*r on*r my*r own,*r but*r the*r Father*r himself*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r given*r me*r a*r command*r to*r say*r everything*r I*r have*r said.*r
I*r know*r that*r his*r command*r is*r eternal*r life.*r So*r the*r things*r that*r I*r speak,*r I*r speak*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r told*r me.”*r
